messages.message: One of my tests just failed because I got a notification that I was halfway through a free trial :grimacing: @Weiming Wu is this something you can help with? Also, we probably don't want our cypress org to run out of a free trial

:grimacing: Hm, there's no front end bypass for those modals... We might be able to resolve it in the backend or with Metronome?
@Xindi Xu @Victor Zeng Any ideas?
Ideally we don't run Cypress tests on any orgs that are on a trial, really. They should all have a license
Ah, I've been just manually extending the license. This will only happen if the PR is > 7 days old. We've ran into this 3 times so far.

@Victor Zeng i think we can update this env var to have a longer trial on crafting-cyp?
`AIHUB_COMMERCIAL_FREE_TRIAL_DURATION`
btw this is called out in the cypress on-call doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_YIkXbxu7NE9FD5SQlJs5qj114LD-6yK__-qMA3sWis/edit?pli=1#heading=h.8zxs1j4db66e)!
I added new plans that will expire in a month :slightly_smiling_face:
can we use those plans for all Cypress CI runs?
what do you mean by that?
when we create users/orgs for Cypress CI, can we use these month-long free trial plans, instead of the default week-long free trial plan?

I see. That's exactly what I meant by updating the env var `AIHUB_COMMERCIAL_FREE_TRIAL_DURATION` in the Cypress CI env. The duration is controlled by the env var. We can't do that with API params because users can hack it and get long free trial plans.
